properties.name: Antique Airfield
properties.description: Posted by Rwflyer  ottumwa, iaAntique Airfield, home of the Airpower Museum and the annual AAA fly-in over Labor Day

properties.name: Auburn Airport
properties.description: Posted by Rwflyer

properties.name: Billings Airport
properties.description: Posted by RwflyerA reasonably friendly regional airport that has hotels that pick up, and non-stop commercial service to Seattle in case the weather isn\'t cooperating. The FBOs all have pretensions of Jet-ness. I\'d stop at Laurel if you\'re just looking for gas or food. That said, one winter evening I had left Sheridan and there was an unforecast howling headwind. I arrived at Billings after dark, with 30 mph gusty winds, freezing cold with ice on the runway. Talking to Billings approach was much welcomed, and they were accomodating about runways.

properties.name: Boulder Airport
properties.description: Posted by Rwflyer No fuel, but might be an emergency stop in a pinch (not likely since it is surrounded by terrain). Rough turf. Tim Talen has a shop here. The Hot Springs Resort is just to the south.

properties.name: Bozeman Airport
properties.description: Posted by Rwflyer A regional field but friendly. Try Arlin\'s for fuel and tiedown - loaner car and great service. Rough grass strip available.

properties.name: Bunker Ruins
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing Ruins of military outposts from various times in history are slowly crumbling and becoming covered in lushness all over the island. Bring your flashlight for exploring. Watch the gigantic bunnies sun themselves on the stones

properties.name: Butte Airport
properties.description: Posted by RwflyerA reasonably friendly FBO, but otherwise not much to recommend Butte. There\'s steep terrain to the north and east, and the pass to the east is very rough.

properties.name: Ephrata Airport
properties.description: Posted by RwflyerHome of big air for soaring. There\'s a small duster FBO for gas. Decent mexican food in town.

properties.name: Felts Field
properties.description: Posted by RwflyerA good overnight and home of an active antique community. The restuarant serves a good breakfast. Classic 1930s airport terminal building, built of out concrete.

properties.name: Frasca Field
properties.description: Posted by Rwflyer   A very nice grass field. Home of the Frasca flight simulator, and home to a great flyable museum of warbirds.

properties.name: Heartland Inn, Ottumwa
properties.description: Posted by Rwflyer Heartland Inn, OttumwaA good place to stay while doing the Blakesburg fly-in

properties.name: Helena Airport
properties.description: Posted by RwflyerFriendly airport, terrain all around but clear approaches. Go to Beck\'s U-Pump for gas, loaner car, and overnight accomodations if need be.

properties.name: Jobster, Inc
properties.description: Posted by Rwflyer206 1st Ave. S, seattle, waSearch for jobs, and if you\'re a recruiter use the power of referrals and targeting to more effectively.

properties.name: Laurel Airport
properties.description: Posted by RwflyerFriendly FBO, and try the Bowling Alley Restaurant for lunch. Good home cookin. It\'s a small world department: In talking to the flight instructor at Laurel, it turned out that she had previously worked out of Ottumwa, Iowa and knew Bob Taylor at Blakesburg.

properties.name: Livingston Airport
properties.description: Posted by Rwflyer Grass strip, big winds

properties.name: Macomb Airport
properties.description: Posted by Rwflyer Ok grass field, but a good stop for short ranged planes from Mattoon to Blakesburg. Ok FBO.

properties.name: Mattoon Airport
properties.description: Posted by Rwflyer Home of Bill Rasmussen and staging place for 2005 Blakesburg. A good airport restuarant, and friendly FBO.

properties.name: Missoula Airport
properties.description: Posted by RwflyerNo grass, but good overnight. Go to Northstar for gas and service. They now have a bunkhouse for cheap overnights, or use the DoubleTree Hotel "Cookie 1" van to get into town.

properties.name: Mitchell Airport
properties.description: Posted by RwflyerVery friendly FBO, with loaner car. Try The Depot restaurant in town for lunch or dinner, good food in the old train station. Home of the Corn Palace.

properties.name: Moses Lake Airport
properties.description: Posted by RwflyerAn ex-B52 base, and still used for 747 flight training. You can spend a lifetime taxiing. The muni airport is much closer in for hotels if you\'re overnighting. Grant County Approach isn\'t indicated on the charts but they\'ll provide low-level radar service across eastern Washington.

properties.name: My Hangar
properties.description: Posted by Rwflyerrenton, waMy restoration hangar at Renton Airport.

properties.name: Pebble Beach
properties.description: Posted by Rwflyer  Home of Addison Pemberton\'s hangar at Felts Field.

properties.name: Pella Airport
properties.description: Posted by RwflyerOk place to stop for gas after leaving Blakesburg

properties.name: Perry Airport
properties.description: Posted by Rwflyer Great grass field, flat fields for miles around

properties.name: Phillip Airport
properties.description: Posted by Rwflyer A rough grass cross runway, but a lifesaver one time when I was returning west and surface winds were out of the south at about 25 mph. It was right down the grass runway! There aren\'t many fields with gas in western South Dakota.

properties.name: Renton Airport
properties.description: Posted by Rwflyerrenton, wa

properties.name: Sheridan Airport
properties.description: Posted by RwflyerFriendly FBO, but a very long taxi to the north/south active runway. No grass, but not much gas around here either. Better fill up while you can. Home of an aircraft cloth cover manufacturer.

properties.name: Sioux City Airport
properties.description: Posted by RwflyerReasonably friendly regional airport. I often stop here at the end of a long day of flying because the location is convenient and the FBO stays open late. A long way from the hotels in town, though. JetSun is a friendly FBO even for small planes.

properties.name: Spearfish Airport
properties.description: Posted by Rwflyer spearfish, sdFriendly field, with some rough grass strips. The FBO is helpful and has hangar space. There are nearby hotels & restaurants that pick up from the airport. The airport is in a bowl, watch the terrain if you have a long descent on the way in. The name of the field is a little intimidating: Clyde *Ice* Field.

properties.name: Sturgis Airport
properties.description: Posted by Rwflyerspearfish, sdPretty desolate. Fuel is dispensed out of the non-moving truck.

properties.name: Thompson Falls Airport
properties.description: Posted by RwflyerGreat surroundings, an old logging town. Try Granny\'s Restaurant for breakfast.

properties.name: Three Forks Airport
properties.description: Posted by Rwflyer A section of grass is available next to the northwest end of the runway. Home of the Montana Antique Airplane Association fly-in. Beautiful territory to fly around in. There\'s a preserved airway lighted beacon and shelter on the field.

properties.name: Winner Airport
properties.description: Posted by Rwflyer Has a grass field, the only gas equipped strip if you take a direct routing to Yankton from Rapid City. Don\'t come here after hours, there\'s no cardlock. Once when I flew up on a Saturday nobody was around, but in about 20 minutes a fellow drove up with his dog to operate the gas pumps. He heard me coming in on final. If you\'re not so lucky you might want to call in advance.

properties.name: Yankton Airport
properties.description: Posted by RwflyerA good place to wait out thunderstorms in the plains. The FBO has loaner cars. The winds pick up from here to the west. I once met a fellow and his wife here who were flying up the Missouri River in a Robinson R44 helicopter, landing on sandbars and sometimes coming into towns. What a great way to fly!
